title: Jonny Bairstow expects New Zealand to have 'fire in their belly' for T20 series following World Cup final defeat
text:
Jonny Bairstow believes a wounded New Zealand will be fired up to avenge last summer’s dramatic 50-over World Cup final defeat at Lord’s when they take on England in a five-match T20 series that starts in Christchurch on Friday.

The hosts will be without captain Kane Williamson for the entire series with a hip injury and there will be notable absentees for the visitors, too, given the three key men who led England to victory in that final three months ago in Ben Stokes, Jofra Archer and Jos Buttler have all been rested.

But another World Cup winner in Bairstow is looking to take centre stage over the coming fortnight after he hit an unbeaten 78 from 45 balls to guide England to a six-wicket victory in their first warm-up match of this tour against a New Zealand XI in Lincoln yesterday.

In that match, the first for Chris Silverwood as head coach, an England side containing three debutants in Tom Banton, Pat Brown and Saqib Mahmood eased to their target of 173 with 11 balls to spare.

However, Bairstow is expecting things to get a lot tougher when the real business begins at Hagley Oval at the end of the week against a New Zealand team who could contain at least seven of the players from the World Cup final.
